etymology.description: semantic: 目 (“eyes”) + phonetic: 冃 (“hat”); 冃 is the original form, 目 was added later; original form of 帽.
etymology.interpretation: A cover (冃) placed over an eye (目) evokes something covering the eyes or emerging from under a cover. From this imagery come senses like to give off or to protrude, and by extension figurative uses such as to risk or to assume a false identity.

examples.chinese: 锅里冒着热气(鍋裡冒著熱氣)。
examples.english: Steam is coming off the pot.

examples.chinese: 他紧张得直冒汗(他緊張得直冒汗)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jǐnzhāng de zhí mào hàn.
examples.english: He was so nervous that sweat kept coming out.
